buildup.text: Freedom of Information (FOI) laws let citizens request government data that isn't proactively published.

discovery.text: Over 120 countries now have FOI laws, establishing transparency as a legal right rather than a government favor.

twist.text: In practice, FOI requests are often delayed, redacted, or denied on vague 'national security' grounds.
